Posts.Content: tonyarmstrong18 wrote: Someone very close to me was recently told they have a very high chance of getting breast cancer... her mom died at low 40's of it and her grandma died in her 50's. The women is in her mid 50s now and is worried since she was genetically screened for a mutant gene... is this really worth it?  it's clear that you have bad genes for it.. why add worry... although the recommended step forward is every 6mo MRI or removal of the breasts.  pretty harsh recommendations if you ask me.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Genetics Testing worth it? tonyarmstrong18 Paula66
